narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Yanin Alexa Kramsky  Yan was excellent.
Instructor: Yanin Alexa Kramsky  Yanin K.
Instructor: Yanin Alexa Kramsky  Yanin
Instructor: Yanin Alexa Kramsky  Yanin

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Yanin Alexa Kramsky  Yan had an excellent command of all of the topics addressed in lecture, and was able to offer useful feedback and additions to discussion.

Instructor: Yanin Alexa Kramsky  Yanin was very accessible through the whole semester. He is a very good listener in terms of being very careful of giving recommendations that really agreed with what you are trying to do in terms of your research. His advice came from his own experience which was very good. He was the perfect TA for this class.
Instructor: Yanin Alexa Kramsky  Yanin is helpful and understanding, and tries their best to help the students in the course. Yanin is also a great facilitator.

Instructor: Yanin Alexa Kramsky  Yanin has been very helpful and approachable throughout the course. The best thing about him was that he provided very useful insights and constructive criticisms to a variety of research ideas/projects.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: This course was one of the stronger offerings I've had at FES. Generally, I find FES faculty disinterested in encouraging meaningful student growth... Amity, however, is genuinely committed to teaching. Her willingness to field challenging questions dealing with her methods and philosophy of research was a breath of fresh air. Amity was also an excellent discussion facilitator, and clearly valued lively classroom debate. The environment that Amity created made for a fruitful learning experience.
Amity is the best. Yanin is the best. This class was the best!
Professor Doolitle is the perfect professor for this course.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Amity's teaching was strong, and the quality of students and discussion in the class was high.
the assignments

Professor Doolittle is a wonderful professor. She knows when and how to guide students to achieve their research goals. I found her teaching style very conducive for optimal learning. She spent time and effort to guide my research plan, and has been extremely helpful in terms of connecting with the right people to make my summer research possible. Professor Doolittle is extremely knowledgeable and has given us some great tools which will help us understand the complexity of our world - an essential skill which I wish I knew before I entered the workplace. Also, Professor Doolittle creates an open and non-judgmental environment in class, where even the quietest people feel comfortable sharing their ideas and perspectives. This makes for an interesting and compassionate classroom environment, and we all often left the class both full of questions and understanding for each other. Thank you Professor for a wonderful class.
This course taught me to view research differently than I would before; it has been a very crucial factor in furthering my interests in research.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The course at times felt ideologically homogenous... although this same critique can be made of virtually every other course at this school.
I really wish we could have talked more about methods

It would have been great to get more guest speakers/researchers discuss the pitfalls in their research, and how they overcame them. It would also be interesting to see more examples of good mixed-method approaches (even if it is covered only in one class). How can qualitative and quantitative methods work together?

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: NA
Very good!
N/A

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Taken as MESc requirement
I really wanted to take a methods class and this class was perfect for that

This is an essential course for my academic background. I am developing a career both as a researcher and practitioner in international development. This course has taught me how to observe, engage and question social environments. I wish I had taken this course before I started my career in public service.
Important class not just for people who want to do independent research but for understanding how to critique and design research.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Requirement for MESc degree
To develop my research proposal and plans for next summer.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes.
Yes!
Yes, but I still have trouble with defining the best methods
They exceeded my expectations.
Exceeded expectations

comments: na

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: A worthwhile course, and a better use of your time than pretty much anything else you might take at this school.
Take the time to go through the readings. And take advantage of Dr. Doolittle's office hours. She is tremendously helpful if you make the effort and seek her advice.
Highly recommend both MEM and MESc students take this course.
